action.action-desc: Mr. Latta (for himself, Mrs. Harshbarger, Mr. Stewart, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, and Mr. Bentz) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to extend the authorization period for emergency treatment in non-Department of Veterans Affairs medical facilities under the Veterans Community Care Program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Addressing Care Timelines for Veterans Act or the ACT for Veterans Act.

section.header: Extension of authorization period for emergency treatment in non-Department of Veterans Affairs medical facilities

paragraph.text: Subsection (a)(3) of section 1703 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking A covered veteran and inserting (A) Except as provided by subparagraph (B), a covered veteran; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

In the case of emergency treatment furnished to a covered veteran by a health care provider specified in subsection (c) in the course of care or services authorized under subparagraph (A), the Secretary may deem such emergency treatment to be authorized under such subparagraph if such covered veteran (or an individual acting on behalf of the covered veteran) or such health care provider submits to the Secretary a notification in such form and containing such information and assurances as the Secretary determines appropriate, except the Secretary may not require such notification to be submitted earlier than 96 hours after the date on which such health care provider furnishes such emergency treatment to such covered veteran.

paragraph.text: Subsection (o) of such section is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (2) as paragraph (3); and
by inserting after paragraph (1), the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: The term emergency treatment has the meaning given such term in section 1725 of this title.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall take effect on the date that is one year after the date of the enactment of this Act.
